I've spent time with a lot of early Bitcoin adopters and people totally commited to it. Few things a lot have in common:
- own or want to buy land (remote, large)
- self-reliance, self-sufficiency
- responsibility (security, tools)
- diet-conscious
- have a "plan b"
- run nodes
Bitstein
@bitstein
 · Nov 4, 2018
Full-stack Bitcoin carnivorism:

* Ecologically-friendly ranch using holistically-managed grazing
* Full Bitcoin node, with LN and redundant data feeds via Internet, satellites, etc.
* Well-stocked armory with advanced defense technology for protecting family, cows, home, & keys

#Ripple is basically modified dPoS.

Thread 

Picture dPoS, but instead of mining blocks, they publish hashes for a global set of account balances (analogous to UTXOs in #Bitcoin). The hash of the UTXO set is like the state root of #Ethereum.
